p.s: If you have a job , lifestyle or role that requires you to work with animals , you 'll soon learn that you need to be gentle , careful and ready to be immersed in how animals view the world .
This can be hard work at times , but can also be very rewarding when you finally find out how to train and work with animals .
It can be a lifetime of learning but the journey has to begin somewhere .

item.s: Know that not all animals will like you .
Not every animal likes to be pet , cuddled , held , or gotten too close to .
Some are less sociable than others , and like to be left alone more than played with .
Sometimes it 's best just to get it another companion of its own kind as its company- some humans do n't like animals , and some animals do n't like humans .
Learn as much as you can about the behaviour in animals .
If you 're around a specific animal a lot do extra research on it to improve you 're performance with it .
Being able to read the animal 's body signals will enable you to know when it 's safe to stay near , and when it 's safer to go away and let the animal recover from its encounter with you .
Use the Internet to research animal behaviour .
Use books and movies from your local library .
Watch nature shows and documentaries .
Spend time with animals , observing their reactions , and behavior .

Talk to someone that has plenty of experience working with animals , like veterinarians or animal patrolmen ; they might be able to open up your eyes on how animals see the world and help you translate what animals do into what they feel .
Approach animals with care .
The main thing to be aware of , is that when you go up to the animal , always take it easy and avoid scaring it .
This includes walking or approaching the animal slowly and possibly crouching down to near the animal 's level , if this is relevant or appropriate .
If the animal reacts by moving away , it may be scared or getting ready to attack if you go any further .
Very slowly back away and give it time to recover .
Allow animals to get a good sense of you and your intentions .
Once you are near the animal , hold your hand out to allow it to get your sent .
This applies for most animals that are able to pick up scents ; from dogs and cats to tigers and wolves .
Talk to them in a soft light toned voice to pose as an ally ; a loud voice will pose as a threat to them .

It is also important that you are feeling secure and confident around the animal , as many animals can sense fear or uncertainty and will assume that you are either inferior or prey as a result of this .
Sit by it while it 's eating , and feed it treats ; this will link you to something they like .
Never go near a stray animal unless it comes to you and is friendly .
Even then , be cautious animals can be sporadic .
Never approach the animal very fast or it may try to defend it self , as it feels it is under attack .
